item.title: Week 2
item.description:
Week 2: Systems Engineering and its Applications

15 mins

Class Content

Here the link for our class slides. To access it you need to login with your University Google account.

Learn

Below a video that explains what is a Full Stack Developer in the context of web development.

Brief Quiz

What are the two roles a Full Stack developer should do?

  • Frontend Developer
  • Backend Developer

Which Two languages are part of frontend development?

  • HTML
  • Java Script

Which Two languages are part of backend development?

  • Ruby
  • Python

item.title: Week 3
item.description:
Week 3: Intro to Google Colab and Python

mins

Class Content

Here the link to the Jupyter Notebook we showed on Google Colab

Learn

Below a short introductory video on Google Colab

Brief Quiz

Where is the Jupyter Notebook running when you execute the cells inside a Google Colab

  • On a Virtual Machine on the Cloud

item.title: Week 4
item.description:
Week 4: List, Dictionaries and Tuples in Python

45 mins

Class Content

During class we will cover the basics of Lists, dictionaries and tuples in Python and some fun exercises with them.

  • Google Colab Jupyter Notebook

Learn

Below a short video if you want to start learning some of the content before class and come with awesome questions.

Brief Quiz

Can I change the contents of a tuple once created?

  • Once created you cannot change the contents of a tuple. This characteristic is called immutable.

item.title: Week 5
item.description:
Week 5: Dataframes part 1: Open data by MinTIC + Pandas + Variables types

2 - 3 Hours

Class Content

  • Google Colab Jupyter Notebook
  • Colombian Government Open Data webpage
    • Application Programming Interface (API) for Colombian Government Open Data: SODA

Assignments

  • Create a Python list with heights and names.
  • Here the link to upload your work the first Activity. Due date and all the details are in this Google Colab (It will be made available Tuesday March 1st right before class). Be sure to make a copy of it. If you do not have your own copy you cannot edit. To access it you need to be logged in with your university email

Learn

Below a nice Introductory tutorial on Pandas Dataframes

NOTE If you watch this before our class it will be an even better time together.

Brief Quiz

What is a famous software that stores data in a similar way than Dataframes?

  • Microsoft Excel
  • Google Spreadsheets

Why Dataframes are so popular?

  • Because they allow you to manipulate, transform and visualize data very easily in a programmatic and repeatable way.
